summary: The Child Tax Credit Relief for Puerto Rican Families Act (H.R. 1697) aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide equitable treatment to Puerto Rican residents regarding the refundable portion of the child tax credit. The bill introduces modifications to ensure that residents of Puerto Rico can benefit from the credit, impacting how the credit is calculated and applied to their income. The amendments are effective for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024.
